Chief Complaint:

Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
Percutaneous cholecystostomy ___

 
History of Present Illness:
___ male with borderline resectable pancreatic cancer stage
IIB (T3 N1 M0) s/p 5 cycles of neoadjuvant FOLFIRINOX, 30Gy
external beam radiation, and distal pancreatectomy with ypT0N0
(___), complicated by pancreatic leak, GIB, PE and
polymicrobial infections, s/p transgastric biopsy on ___
showing recurrent adenocarcinoma, presenting from clininc with
severe abdominal pain found to have acute cholecystitis

He states he was ___ his usual state of health until a few days
ago . He was ___ ___ for Stand up to cancer event when he began to
have increasing RUQ pain. He also noted some nausea. He flew 
back
home yesterday and began to have dry heaves. He denies any 
fevers
or sick contacts. He went to see his outpatient team who noted a
positive ___ sign on exam. They sent him for urgent RUQUS
which was read as "gallbladder wall is  irregular with some 
focal
edema.  The appearance is worrisome for cholecystitis." He was
given cipro and flagyl. Labs were sent which were remarkable for
elevated WBC 23.3, normal LFTs. He was subsequently directly
admitted to medicine floor. 

On arrival to the floor he is having ___ RUQ pain. He denies 
any
other symptoms.

 
Past Medical History:
PAST ONCOLOGIC HISTORY (Per OMR, reviewed):
Pancreatic cancer stage IIB (T3N1M0)
- ___ CT urogram for history of kidney stones showed
normal kidneys bilaterally w/o any stones. Incidentally, was
noted to have a 4.5 x 4.4 x 5cm enhancing mass along the lesser
curvature ofhte stomach, extending inferiorly 
into the pancreatic tail. From the study, unclear if mass was
arising from the stomach or pancreas. 
- ___ EGD revealed a possible submucosal mass on the
gastric side of the  GE junction ___ the cardia, which was
biopsied and normal. Although HP immunostains were negative, he
was started on Prevpac for possible HP infection. GI recommended
dedicated CTAP. 
- ___ CT abdomen and pelvis demonstrated a 5 x 5 x 4.6 cm
mass contiguous with the superior aspect of the proximal
pancreatic tail causing extrinsic compression on the lesser
curvature of the stomach. 
- ___ EUS showed a 4.7 x 3.2 cm pancreatic tail mass 
which
did invade the muscular propria of the gastric wall. Although
differential for GIST or NET, FNA/B c/w poorly differentiated
adenosquamous carcinoma (positive for 
cytokeratin AE1/3 CAM5.2 and focally positive for p40, p63 and
mucicarmine  stains. Synaptophysin, chromogranin, and CDX2
immunostains are negative)
- ___ CT torso showed an extensive tumor involving the
pancreatic body/tail and extending to the gastric wall to the
left adrenal gland. CT chest notable for a subcarcinal lesion
concerning for a nodal conglomerate versus unrelated lesion. 
- ___ C1D1 FOLFIRINOX
- ___ C1D15 FOLFIRINOX (no bolus ___, Iri 150 mg/m2)
delayed for low PLT and diarrhea. 
- ___ Biopsy of the paraesophageal lesion showed no
metastatic disease but nondiagnostic
- ___ Start isoquercetin 1000 mg PO daily on ___
- ___ C2D1 FOLFIRINOX (no bolus ___, Iri 150 mg/m2)
- ___ CTA torso showed substantial reduction ___ disease
burden
- ___ C3D1 FOLFIRINOX (no bolus ___ 1800 mg/m2, Iri
135 mg/m2) dose reduced for mild mucositis and diarrhea
- ___ ___ FOLFIRINOX (no bolus ___ 1800 mg/m2, Iri
135 mg/m2) delayed for patient vacation
- ___ C4D1 FOLFIRINOX (no bolus ___ 1800 mg/m2, Iri
135 mg/m2)
- ___ Held chemo for toxicity
- ___ CTA torso showed further reduction ___ disease 
burden
- ___ C4D15 dose of FOLFIRINOX (no bolus ___ 1800
mg/m2, Iri 100 mg/m2) reduced for fatigue and diarrhea
- ___ C5D1 FOLFOX (no bolus ___ 1800 mg/m2, Iri on
hold) for fatigue and diarrhea
- ___ Start chemoXRT with sensitizing capecitabine
- ___ Complete chemoXRT with 30 Gy to the tumor bed and
margins
- ___ Underwent distal pancreatectomy and splenectomy 
with
intraoperative XRT of 10 Gy to the margin. Pathology showed a
ypT0N0 complete response with 22 LNs assessed. 

PAST MEDICAL HISTORY:
- Status post total knee replacement on the left.

- Diabetes.

Brief Hospital Course:
___ male with borderline resectable pancreatic cancer 
stage IIB (T3 N1 M0), s/p 5 cycles of neoadjuvant FOLFIRINOX 
(dose reduced and iri held given toxicity), s/p 30Gy SBRT with 
capecitabine at ___, now s/p distal pancreatectomy and 
splenectomy with intraoperative XRT of 10 Gy to the margin, with 
ypT0N0, complicated by pancreatic leak, GIB, PE and 
polymicrobial infections, with biopsy proven recurrence at the 
gastric fundus
s/p three doses of FOLFIRI, who presented with cholecystitis, 
s/p perc chole tube on ___ with relief of symptoms and 
downtrending WBC count. He was kept on unasyn and discharged on 
augmentin to complete a ___holecystitis
With low grade temp and leukocytosis and evidence of 
cholecystitis on US. Surgery evaluated patient and favored ___ 
guided perc chole (___) which patient tolerated well. His 
apixaban was restarted without incident the morning after the 
procedure. He was kept on Unasyn and transitioned to augmentin 
for 7day course (___) set to end ___.
- Surgery following: to f/u with Dr. ___ ___ ___ weeks after

Discharge Instructions:
Dear Mr ___, 

It was a pleasure taking care of you here at ___ 
___. 

WHY YOU WERE ADMITTED:
You were admitted to the hospital with infection of the 
gallbladder. You had a tube placed to drain the infected 
material and will complete a course of antibiotics. 

WHAT TO DO WHEN YOU GO HOME:
- Take your Augmentin twice per day, 12 hours apart (first dose 
___ ___ the evening). The course ends on ___.
- Follow up with Dr. ___ surgery to make sure you are 
healing properly. 
- Keep track of how much fluid the drain puts out. If the fluid 
output ceases or becomes very minimal, it may be time to remove 
the drain.
- If you develop fevers, abdominal pain, change ___ the drainage 
color or any other symptom that concerns you please call your 
oncologist right away. 

We wish you the best! 
Your care team
 
Followup Instructions:
___

qafib.question: Does the note describe the patient as having permanent, paroxysmal, or persistent afib?

qprior_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having a stroke or transient ischemic attack?

qarterial_hypertension.question: Does the note describe the patient as having arterial hypertension on treatment (high bp e.g. >140, or HTN)?

qt2d.question: Does the note describe the patient as having Diabetes mellitus (DM1, DM2, T2D, T1DM, T2DM)?

qheart_failure.question: Does the note describe the patient as having heart failure?

qsurgical_valvular_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having valvular disease requiring surgery (stenosis)?

qafib_ablation.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a planned or past ablation procedure for afib?

qbleeding.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a serious bleeding in the past 6 months?

qpeptic_ulcer_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having peptic ulcer disease?

qrecent_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a stroke during this admission or within the last month? (Answer yes for any recent stroke if the date is unclear)

qhemorrhagic.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having any hemorrhagic tendencies or blood dyscrasias?

qbipolar.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with bipolar disorder?

qschizophrenia.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with schizophrenia or any schizoaffective disorders?

qmdd.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with depression or major depressive disorder (MDD)?

qmed_decisions.question: Does the note describe the patient as being unable to make medical decisions? (Answer no unless there is evidence the patient cannot make their own medical decisions).

qchads2.question: What is the highest CHADS2 score mentioned? Answer "NA" if no CHADS2 score is in the note.

qblood_glucose.question: What is the highest blood glucose lab mentioned? Answer "NA" if no blood glucose score is in the note.

qlvef.question: What is the lowest left ventricular ejection (LVEF, ef, ejection fraction) fraction mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no LVEF is in the note, Answer 55 if the lowest value is 55% or greater.

qPLT.question: What is the lowest platelet count (PLT) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no platelet count is available in the note.

qHGB.question: What is the lowest hemoglobin (HGB) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no HGB value is available in the note.

qCREAT.question: What is the higest serum creatinine (Creat) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no creatinine value is available in the note.

qAST.question: What is the higest aspartate aminotransferase level (AST) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no AST value is available in the note.

qBILI.question: What is the higest total bilirubin (TotBili, Bili) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no bilirubin value is available in the note.
